message_1: Consider the space $X=S^1 \times S^1$, which is the torus. Compute the cohomology groups $H^k(X;\mathbb{Z})$ for $k=0,1,2$.
message_2:
To compute the cohomology groups of the torus $X = S^1 \times S^1$, we can use the Künneth formula, which states that for spaces $A$ and $B$ and a field $F$, we have:

$$H^k(A \times B; F) \cong \bigoplus_{i+j=k} H^i(A; F) \otimes H^j(B; F)$$

In our case, $A = B = S^1$, and $F = \mathbb{Z}$. We know that the cohomology groups of $S^1$ are:

$$H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}$$
$$H^1(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}$$
$$H^k(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) = 0 \text{ for } k \geq 2$$

Now we can use the Künneth formula to compute the cohomology groups of the torus:

For $k = 0$:
$$H^0(X; \mathbb{Z}) \cong H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \otimes H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \cong \mathbb{Z} \otimes \mathbb{Z} \cong \mathbb{Z}$$

For $k = 1$:
$$H^1(X; \mathbb{Z}) \cong H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \otimes H^1(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \oplus H^1(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \otimes H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \cong \mathbb{Z} \oplus \mathbb{Z}$$

For $k = 2$:
$$H^2(X; \mathbb{Z}) \cong H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \otimes H^2(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \oplus H^1(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \otimes H^1(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \oplus H^2(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \otimes H^0(S^1; \mathbb{Z}) \cong \mathbb{Z}$$

For $k \geq 3$, all cohomology groups are trivial since at least one of the factors in the tensor product will be zero.

In summary, the cohomology groups of the torus $X = S^1 \times S^1$ with coefficients in $\mathbb{Z}$ are:

$$H^0(X; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}$$
$$H^1(X; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z} \oplus \mathbb{Z}$$
$$H^2(X; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}$$
$$H^k(X; \mathbb{Z}) = 0 \text{ for } k \geq 3$$
